au.gov.ga.conn4d.utils

Class CoordinateMath

  • java.lang.Object
    • au.gov.ga.conn4d.utils.CoordinateMath

  • public class CoordinateMath
extends java.lang.Object
    Functions for performing vector operations on the jts.Coordinate object
    Author:
    Johnathan Kool

      • angle3DSigned

        public static final double angle3DSigned(com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate p1,
                   com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate vertex,
                   com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate p2)
        Returns the angle between two lines in 3D space. In this case, the direction of the angle is relative to the sweep from the first arm to the second.
        Parameters:
        p1 - - the terminus of one angle arm
        vertex - - the vertex of the angle
        p2 - - the terminus of the second angle arm.

      • angle3DSigned

        public static final double angle3DSigned(com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate p1,
                   com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate vertex,
                   com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate p2,
                   com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate reference)
        Returns the angle between two lines in 3D space. In this case, the direction of the angle is relative to the reference Coordinate.
        Parameters:
        p1 - - the terminus of one angle arm
        vertex - - the vertex of the angle
        p2 - - the terminus of the second angle arm.
        reference - - the reference coordinate

      • rotate3D

        public static final com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate rotate3D(com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate point,
                                              com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate axis,
                                              double theta)
        3D rotation of a point about an arbitrary axis by a given angle. From http://inside.mines.edu/~gmurray/ArbitraryAxisRotation/
        Parameters:
        point - - the point to be rotated.
        axis - - a Coordinate representing the axis of rotation assuming the starting point lies at the origin.
        theta - - the angle of rotation in radians.

      • rotate3Dn

        public static final com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate rotate3Dn(com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate point,
                                               com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate axis,
                                               double theta)
        3D rotation of a point about an arbitrary axis by a given angle, assuming a normalized axis (i.e. length = 1) From http://inside.mines.edu/~gmurray/ArbitraryAxisRotation/
        Parameters:
        point - - the point to be rotated.
        axis - - a Coordinate representing the normalized axis of rotation assuming the starting point lies at the origin.
        theta - - the angle of rotation in radians.

      • rotate3D

        public static final com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate rotate3D(com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate point,
                                              com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate axis,
                                              com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate reference,
                                              double theta)
        3D rotation of a point about an arbitrary axis by a given angle. From http://inside.mines.edu/~gmurray/ArbitraryAxisRotation/
        Parameters:
        point - - the point to be rotated.
        axis - - a Coordinate representing the axis of rotation relative to the reference point.
        reference - - the reference point for the rotation.
        theta - - the angle of rotation in radians.

      • rotate3Dn

        public static final com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate rotate3Dn(com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate point,
                                               com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate axis,
                                               com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate reference,
                                               double theta)
        3D rotation of a point about an arbitrary axis by a given angle, assuming a normalized axis (i.e. length = 1) is used. From http://inside.mines.edu/~gmurray/ArbitraryAxisRotation/
        Parameters:
        point - - the point to be rotated.
        axis - - a Coordinate representing the normalized axis of rotation relative to the reference point.
        reference - - the reference point for the rotation.
        theta - - the angle of rotation in radians.
